title: Integrate with Smartsheet for SAM
content:
This page describes how to configure integration with Smartsheet to import user entitlement data from Smartsheet. This is part of the SaaS product setup in SAM.

Generate an API key in Smartsheet

You need to enter a Smartsheet API key (token) when you set up the Smartsheet integration in Service Management. To generate the API key, perform the following steps in Smartsheet:

  1. On the left Navigation Bar, select Account.
  2. Select Apps & Integrations.
  3. In the Personal Settings form, select API Access.
  4. In the API Access tab, select Generate new access token. Copy the generated token. For security reasons, it will not be visible again in your account settings.

Prepare an integration user

Prepare an integration user before setting up the integration. For details of how to prepare an integration user, see Prepare an integration user.

Set up the Smartsheet integration in Service Management

To set up the Smartsheet integration for Smartsheet data import, perform the following steps.

Create an endpoint

Create an endpoint using the Rest Executor 2.0 endpoint type:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as the integration administrator.

  2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints.

  3. Click Add.

  4. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter a name for the endpoint (for example, Smartsheet), and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint.

  5. Click Configure and complete the following fields.

    • Agent: Select Agentless for a direct connection to the Smartsheet API.

    • Authentication type: Select Bearer Token.

    • Protocol: Select https.

    • Base URL: Enter https://api.smartsheet.com.

    • Token: Paste the Smartsheet API key to this field.

    • Certificate type: (optional) Select X.509.

    • Certificate format: (optional) Select PEM.

    • Server certificate: (optional).

      Open the root CA certificate file of the Smartsheet system in a text editor, and then copy and paste the content to this field. If the content is invalid, an error occurs when you click Save in the next step.

  6. Click Save.

Create an integration

In the following steps, you'll create an integration with the predefined template.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select REST API (under Smartsheet) as the connector, select the Smartsheet endpoint that you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.

Add the scenario

Perform the following steps to add a scenario to the integration:

  1. Click Add scenario.

  2. Enter a name for the scenario. For example, "Import Smartsheet user entitlements".

  3. In the Template field, select SAM - Import Smartsheet user entitlement (under Smartsheet REST API).

    • Using the out-of-the-box template simplifies integration configuration compared to starting from scratch. If you choose not to use this option, you'll need to manually build your logic from a blank page.
    • You can update the APIVersion key in the template based on your business requirements.

  4. Click Save to add the scenario.

Next steps

Complete the remaining steps of the SaaS product configuration process:

  • Create and configure the Smartsheet product in SAM
  • Create license metrics (if necessary)
  • Create licenses for services included in Smartsheet (if necessary)
  • Verify the Smartsheet integration
  • Verify the details of the license models for Smartsheet services
  • Schedule the periodic triggering of the integration
